Summary Patrick Garr joined Expense Reduction Analysts (ERA) in mid 2008. Since then his clients have enjoyed average savings of 26.9%. He works as both a client manager and analyst and takes great pride in providing first class service for his clients. This service includes timely and relevant communication during all stages of a review, working tirelessly with suppliers to ensure they are meeting or exceeding his clients’ quality and service requirements, and ensuring supplier pricing is correct down to the last penny. 
 
Before joining ERA, Patrick was a Senior Business Architect with Intel Corporation, the global microchip manufacturing giant. During his 12+ year career there, he delivered global supply chain, capital equipment procurement, and business process design solutions which resulted in savings in excess of $80 million. He was responsible for process design, analysis, redesign, implementation, and measurement, and this experience prepared him well to deliver great results for his ERA clients. 
 
Patrick’s areas of expertise related to overhead cost reduction include consumable packaging supplies, factory consumables, and industrial chemicals & gases. 
 
Patrick holds a B.S. in Industrial & Systems Engineering from Virginia Tech. In October 2009, he was named to the ERA President’s Circle, an award presented to the top 5% of ERA consultants nationally.
